translation: Golden Light Sutra, Volume 3

source_sentence: 北涼三藏法師曇無讖譯
translation: Translated by Dharmakṣema, the Tripiṭaka Master of Northern Liang

source_sentence: 金光明經散脂鬼神品第十
translation: Jin guangming jing sangshi guijin pin 10

source_sentence: 爾時散脂鬼神大將，及二十八部諸鬼神等，即從座起，偏袒右肩右膝著地，白佛言：「世尊！
translation: It was then that the general of the demons of the Trash and the twenty-eight groups of demons rose from their seats, bared their right shoulders and knelt on their right knees, and said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 是金光明微妙經典，若現在世及未來世，在在處處，若城邑聚落、若山澤空處、若王宮宅，隨是經典所流布處，我當與此二十八部大鬼神等，往至彼所隱蔽其形，隨逐擁護是說法者，消滅諸惡令得安隱；及聽法眾，若男若女童男童女，於是經中乃至得聞一如來名、一菩薩名及此經典首題名字，受持讀誦，我當隨侍宿衛擁護，悉滅其惡令得安隱，及國邑城郭，若王宮殿、舍宅空處，皆亦如是。
translation: "If this subtle sūtra of golden light were to be disseminated in the present and future worlds, in cities and towns, in empty places in mountains and swamps, or in the palaces and mansions of kings, I would go with these twenty-eight great spirits and other spirits to hide their forms, follow them around, and support this Dharma speaker, extinguishing all evil and making it peaceful; and if listeners of the Dharma, boys and girls, even those who hear the name of the Rājagṛha, the name of the One Bodhisattva, and the title of this sūtra, memorize and recite it, I would accompany and guard them, extinguishing all evil and making it peaceful, as well as countries and cities, and empty places in the palaces and mansions of kings, and so on.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 何因緣故，我名散脂鬼神大將？
translation: What is the reason I'm called the great general of the fat-scattering ghosts and spirits?

source_sentence: 唯然世尊，自當證知。
translation: Only so, Bhagavān, will you yourself realize it.

source_sentence: 「世尊！
translation: "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我知一切法一切緣法，了一切法，知法分齊，如法安住一切法如性，於一切法含受一切法。
translation: I know all things, have all things in view, comprehend all things, know the division of things, abide in the true nature of all things according to the teaching, and contain and experience all things in all things.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我現見不可思議智光、不可思議智炬、不可思議智行、不可思議智聚、不可思議智境。
translation: I now see the unfathomable light of cognition, the unfathomable torch of cognition, the unfathomable practice of cognition, the unfathomable cluster of cognition, and the unfathomable object of cognition.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我於諸法正解正觀，得正分別，正解於緣，正能覺了。
translation: I correctly understand and correctly observe all dharmas, attain correct discrimination, correctly understand their conditions, and correctly comprehend them.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 以是義故，名散脂大將。
translation: For this reason, he's called the great general of fat scattering.

source_sentence: 「世尊！
translation: "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我散脂大將，令說法者莊嚴言辭辯不斷絕，眾味精氣從毛孔入，充益身力心進勇銳，成就不可思議智慧入正憶念，如是等事悉令具足心無疲厭，身受諸樂心得歡喜，以是意故，能為眾生廣說是經。
translation: I spread fat, the great general, so that the speaker of the teaching's ornate words and eloquence won't cease, the energy of many flavors enters through his pores, enriches his physical strength and mental vigor, achieves inconceivable wisdom and enters right recollection, completes such things without weariness in mind, experiences physical pleasure, and rejoices in heart, and because of this intention, I can explain this sūtra extensively for sentient beings.

source_sentence: 「若有眾生，於百千佛所種諸善根，說法之人，為是眾生於閻浮提內，廣宣流布是妙經典令不斷絕；無量眾生聞是經已，當得不可思議智聚，攝取不可思議功德之聚，於未來世無量百千劫，人天之中常受快樂，於未來世值遇諸佛，疾得證成阿耨多羅三藐三菩提。
translation: "If sentient beings planted good roots in a hundred thousand buddha-places and someone who teaches them widely proclaims and disseminates this wonderful sūtra for them in Jambudvīpa so that it doesn't stop, measureless sentient beings who hear this sūtra will attain an unfathomable stock of wisdom and gather an unfathomable stock of merit, which will always bring happiness among humans and gods for measureless hundreds of thousands of eons in the future, meet the buddhas in the future, and quickly realize unsurpassed, correct, and complete enlightenment.

source_sentence: 一切眾苦、三惡趣分永滅無餘。
translation: All suffering and the three bad destinies will be permanently extinguished without remainder.

source_sentence: 「南無寶華功德海琉璃金山光照如來、應供、正遍知。
translation: "Homage to the Tathāgata, Worthy of Offerings, and Perfectly Omniscient, who shines from the lapis lazuli golden mountain, a jeweled-flower ocean of merit.

source_sentence: 南無無量百千億那由他莊嚴其身釋迦如來、應供、正遍知，熾然如是微妙法炬。
translation: In the south, there's the immeasurable trillion nayutas that adorn his body, the Śākyamuni Tathāgata, Worthy of Offerings, and Perfectly Omniscient, blazing with such a subtle dharma-torch.

source_sentence: 南無第一威德成就眾事大功德天。
translation: Homage to the most authoritative, accomplished, and greatly meritorious god.

source_sentence: 南無不可思量智慧功德成就大辯天。」
translation: In the south, there's the Heaven of Great Eloquence, accomplished by unfathomable wisdom and merit."

source_sentence: 金光明經正論品第十一
translation: Jingmingming jingzhengzheng lun pin diyi

source_sentence: 爾時佛告地神堅牢：「過去有王名力尊相，其王有子名曰信相，不久當受灌頂之位統領國土。
translation: It was then that the Buddha addressed the earth spirit Kyanjo, "There was a king in the past named Pṛthivī, and the king had a son named Shinshō who would soon be given the position of consecrator and rule the land.

source_sentence: 爾時父王告其大子信相：『世有正論，善治國土。
translation: It was then that the father king told his eldest son, Nobuhiro, 'There are correct theories in the world that govern the land well.

source_sentence: 我於昔時曾為大子，不久亦當紹父王位。
translation: I was the eldest son in the past, and I will soon assume the position of king.

source_sentence: 爾時父王持是正論，亦為我說，我以是論於二萬歲善治國土，未曾一念以非法行，於自眷屬情無愛著。』
translation: At the time, my father held this right theory and also taught it for me, saying, 'I've used this theory to rule the land well for 20,000 years, and I've never had a single thought of doing something that's not the Dharma, and I have no attachment to my own family members.'

source_sentence: 何等名為治世正論？
translation: What's called the right theory of governing the world?

source_sentence: 「地神！
translation: "Earth gods!

source_sentence: 爾時力尊相王為信相大子，說是偈言：「『我今當說，　　諸王正論，　　為利眾生，　　斷諸疑惑。
translation: It was then that the Venerable Sagacious King spoke this verse for the Great Son of Faith, saying, "Now, I will explain the correct theories of the kings for the benefit of sentient beings and to end their doubts and confusions.

source_sentence: 一切人王、　　諸天天王，　　應當歡喜，　　合掌諦聽。
translation: All the human kings and heavenly kings should rejoice, join their palms, and listen closely.

source_sentence: 諸王和合，　　集金剛山，　　護世四鎮，　　起問梵王：　「大師梵尊，　　天中自在，　　能除疑惑，　　當為我斷。
translation: The kings, united, gathered on Vajragiri, the four guardian kings, arose and asked Brahmā, "Great teacher, Brahmā, who is at ease among the gods, can remove doubt and confusion and will end it for me.

source_sentence: 云何是人，　　得名為天？
translation: How did this person attain the title of god?

source_sentence: 云何人王，　　復名天子？
translation: "What kind of human king is also called a son of the gods?

source_sentence: 生在人中，　　處王宮殿，　　正法治世，　　而名為天？」
translation: Born among men, placed in the king's palace, rightly ruling the world, and called a god?"

source_sentence: 護世四王，　　問是事已，　　時梵尊師，　　即說偈言：　　「汝今雖以，　　此義問我，　　我要當為，　　一切眾生，　　敷揚宣暢，　　第一勝論。
translation: After the four guardian kings asked about this matter, the then-honored Brahmā teacher spoke in verse, saying, "Even though you've asked me about this meaning, I will explain and disseminate the most excellent teaching for all sentient beings.

source_sentence: 因集業故，　　生於人中，　　王領國土，　　故稱人王。
translation: Because of the actions they've gathered, they're born among humans and rule their land, which is why they're called the human king.

source_sentence: 處在胎中，　　諸天守護，　　或先守護，　　然後入胎；　　雖在人中，　　生為人王，　　以天護故，　　復稱天子。
translation: Although he was in the womb and guarded by the gods, or guarded first and then entered the womb, he was born among humans as a human king and is again called a son of the gods because the gods guard him.

source_sentence: 三十三天，　　各以己德，　　分與是人，　　故稱天子。
translation: Each of the Trāyastriṃśa gods shares his virtue with this person, so he's called a son of the gods.

source_sentence: 神力所加，　　故得自在；　　遠離惡法，　　遮令不起；　　安住善法，　　修令增廣；　　能令眾生，　　多生天上。
translation: Because of their psychic powers, they attain mastery; they are free from bad qualities and prevent them from rising; they abide in good qualities and cultivate them to increase; and they cause sentient beings to be reborn in the heavens.

source_sentence: 半名人王，　　亦名執樂，　　羅剎魁膾，　　能遮諸惡；　　亦名父母，　　教誨修善。
translation: Half a persona king, also known as Pārśva, the Rāṣṭrapāla chieftain, can shield against evil and is also known as a father and mother who teaches and cultivates goodness.

source_sentence: 示現果報，　　諸天所護；　　善惡諸業，　　現在未來，　　現受果報，　　諸天所護；　　若有惡事，　　縱而不問，　　不治其罪，　　不以正教，　　捨遠善法，　　增長惡趣，　　故使國中，　　多諸姦鬪，　　三十三天，　　各生瞋恨，　　由其國王，　　縱惡不治。
translation: He shows the results of manifest activity and is protected by the gods; the present and future are the results of good and bad actions, and the gods protect them; if he connives at evil deeds and doesn't ask questions, doesn't punish their crimes, doesn't teach them correctly, abandons good qualities, and proliferates bad destinies, that causes many fights in his country and anger in each of the Trāyastriṃśa gods; that's because his king connives at evil and doesn't punish it.

source_sentence: 壞國正法，　　姦詐熾盛；　　他方怨敵，　　競來侵掠；　　自家所有，　　錢財珍寶，　　諸惡盜賊，　　共來劫奪。
translation: He corrupts the country's right principles, becomes deceitful and rampant, makes enemies from other lands compete and plunder it, and owns money, property, and treasure that bad thieves and pirates jointly plunder.

source_sentence: 如法治世，　　不行是事；　　若行是者，　　其國殄滅。
translation: Such a rule doesn't allow such things in this world; if they did, their country would perish.

source_sentence: 譬如狂象，　　踏蓮花池，　　暴風卒起，　　屢降惡雨，　　惡星數出，　　日月無光，　　五穀果實，　　咸不滋茂；　　由王捨正，　　使國饑饉，　　天於宮殿，　　悉懷愁惱，　　由王暴虐，　　不修善事。」
translation: It's like a mad elephant that treads on a lotus-flower pond, a storm suddenly arises, bad rain frequently falls, bad stars frequently emerge, the sun and moon have no light, and the fruits of five grains don't flourish; the king's disregard for what's right causes the country to starve, and the gods in their palaces are all troubled, because the king is tyrannical and doesn't cultivate good works."

source_sentence: 是諸天王，　　各相謂言：　　「是王行惡，　　與惡為伴。
translation: The god kings then each said to one another, "That king does evil and keeps evil company.

source_sentence: 以造惡故，　　速得天瞋；　　以天瞋故，　　不久國敗，　　非法兵仗、　　姦詐鬪訟、　　疾疫惡病，　　集其國土。」
translation: Because of his evil deeds, he quickly becomes angry with the gods; because of his anger, his country soon loses its power, and unlawful warfare, fraud, and fighting, and bad diseases and epidemics gather in his land."

source_sentence: 諸天即便，　　捨離是王，　　令其國敗，　　生大愁惱。
translation: Even if the gods abandoned that king, it would cause their country to fail and give rise to great sorrow.

source_sentence: 兄弟姊妹、　　眷屬妻子，　　孤迸流離，　　身亦滅亡；　　流星數墮、　　二日並現；　　他方惡賊，　　侵掠其土；　　人民飢餓，　　多諸疾疫；　　所重大臣，　　捨離薨亡；　　象馬車乘，　　一念喪滅；　　諸家財產，　　國土所有，　　互相劫奪，　　刀兵而死；　　五星諸宿，　　違失常度；　　諸惡疾疫，　　流遍其國；　　諸受寵祿，　　所任大臣，　　及諸群僚，　　專行非法，　　如是行惡，　　偏受恩遇，　　修善法者，　　日日衰滅；　　於行惡者，　　而生恭敬，　　見修善者，　　心不顧錄。
translation: Brothers, sisters, retinues, and wives are all orphaned and left behind, and their bodies perish; meteorites fall, and both suns appear; vicious thieves from another land invade it; people starve, and epidemics abound; valued ministers are abandoned and die; elephants, horses, and chariots are killed with a single thought; the property of their families and the possessions of their land are plundered from one another, and they are killed by swords and armies; the five stars and constellations are out of alignment; bad epidemics spread throughout their land; favored officials, ministers, and servants exclusively engage in unlawful behavior; those who do evil in this way are favorably treated; those who cultivate good qualities perish day by day; those who do evil are respected, and those who cultivate goodness are disregarded.

source_sentence: 故使世間，　　三異並起，　　星宿失度，　　降暴風雨，　　破壞甘露、　　無上正法、　　眾生等類，　　及以地肥；　　恭敬弊惡，　　毀諸善人，　　故天降雹、　　飢餓疫病；　　穀米果實，　　滋味衰減；　　多病眾生，　　充滿其國；　　甘美盛果，　　日日損減；　　苦澁惡味，　　隨時增長。
translation: As a result, three worldly differences arise, the stars and constellations are lost, violent winds and rains fall, destroying the nectar, the unsurpassed right teaching, and the fertility of sentient beings and other living things; venerating evil and disparaging good people, the heavens rain down hail, hunger and epidemics, the taste of grain and rice declines, sickly sentient beings fill their lands, the sweet and abundant fruit declines day by day, and the bitter and unpleasant taste grows from time to time.

source_sentence: 本所遊戲，　　可愛之處，　　悉皆枯悴，　　無可樂者；　　眾生所食，　　精妙上味，　　漸漸損減；　　食無肥膚，　　顏貌醜陋，　　氣力衰微；　　凡所食噉，　　不知厭足；　　力精勇猛　　悉滅無有；　　嬾惰懈怠，　　充滿其國；　　多有病苦，　　逼切其身；　　惡星變動，　　羅剎亂行。
translation: The pleasant places where they used to play are all withered, and there's nothing to enjoy; the subtle and superior flavors that sentient beings eat gradually diminish; their skin is devoid of fat, their appearance is ugly, and their strength weakens; they don't know when they've eaten or devoured enough; their strength and vigor cease to exist; their country is filled with laziness and indolence; they suffer from many illnesses that cut their bodies; their stars are shifted, and rājasasas act chaotically.

source_sentence: 若有人王，　　行於非法，　　增長惡伴，　　損人天道，　　於三有中，　　多受苦惱，　　起如是等，　　無量惡事，　　皆由人王，　　愛著眷屬，　　縱之造惡，　　捨而不治。
translation: If there are human kings who behave unlawfully, increase bad company, undermine the human and divine paths, experience much suffering and distress in the three existences, and produce countless other bad deeds like these, it's all because of human kings who are attached to their retinue, indulge in evil deeds, and abandon them without remedying them.

source_sentence: 若為諸天，　　所護生者，　　如是人王，　　終不為是。
translation: If gods were to guard those who are born, such human kings would never be like that.

source_sentence: 有行善者，　　得生天中；　　行不善者，　　墮在三塗；　　三十三天，　　皆生焦熱。
translation: Those who do good deeds are born among the gods, but those who do unskillful deeds fall into the three destinies, and the Trāyastriṃśa gods all become scorched.

source_sentence: 由王縱惡，　　捨而不治，　　違逆諸天，　　及父母勅，　　不能正治，　　則非孝子；　　起諸姦惡，　　壞國土者，　　不應縱捨，　　當正治罪。
translation: Because a king indulges in evil, abandons it without correcting it, disobeys the gods and his parents' commands, and can't correctly correct them, then he's not a filial son; someone who commits adultery and destroys the land shouldn't indulge in it; they'll be correctly corrected for their crimes.

source_sentence: 是故諸天，　　護持是王，　　以滅惡法，　　修習善故，　　現世正治，　　得增王位，　　應各為說，　　善不善業，　　能示因果，　　故得為王。
translation: Therefore, the gods protect this king because they cease bad qualities and cultivate goodness, rightly rule in the present life, and gain ascendancy to the throne, each teaching good and unskillful actions that show the result of causes and conditions, and so they become king.

source_sentence: 諸天護持，　　隣王佐助，　　為自為他，　　修正治國；　　有壞國者，　　應當正教，　　為命及國，　　修行正法，　　不應行惡，　　惡不應縱，　　所有餘事，　　不能壞國。
translation: The gods will support them, the neighboring kings will assist them, and they'll fix and govern the kingdom for themselves and for others. Those who damage the kingdom should teach correctly, cultivate the right principles for their lives and for the kingdom, refrain from doing evil, and don't tolerate evil; nothing else will damage the kingdom.

source_sentence: 要因多姦，　　然後傾敗，　　若起多姦，　　壞於國土。
translation: It's only because of much adultery that it will be spoiled, and if much adultery arises, the country will be destroyed.

source_sentence: 譬如大象，　　壞蓮華池；　　怨恨諸天，　　故天生惱，　　起諸惡事，　　彌滿其國。
translation: It's like an elephant that destroys a lotus-pond, and resentful gods that give rise to natural afflictions and cause evil deeds that fill their land.

source_sentence: 是故應隨，　　正法治世，　　以善化國，　　不順非法；　　寧捨身命，　　不愛眷屬，　　於親非親，　　心常平等：　　視親非親，　　和合為一。
translation: Therefore, you should follow them, rightly rule the world, transform the country with goodness and not with disobedience, prefer to sacrifice your life and not to love your dependents, always be equal in mind when you're related and not related, and regard those who are related and not related as being unified into one.

source_sentence: 正行名稱，　　流布三界，　　正法治國，　　人多行善；　　常以善心，　　仰瞻國王，　　能令天眾，　　具足充滿；　　是故正治，　　名為人王。
translation: He correctly practices name, disseminates it throughout the three realms, correctly rules his country, and has people doing good deeds; always looks up to the king with a good heart, and he causes the gods to be fully filled; therefore, he's correctly ruled and is called the king of men.

source_sentence: 一切諸天，　　愛護人王，　　猶如父母，　　擁護其子；　　故令日月，　　五星諸宿，　　隨其分齊，　　不失常度；　　風雨隨時，　　無諸災禍，　　令國豐實，　　安樂熾盛，　　增益人民，　　諸天之眾。
translation: All the gods love and protect the human king like a parent who guards his child; therefore, they cause the sun and moon and the five stars and constellations to follow their alignments and not lose their regularity, cause the wind and rain to rain at all times, prevent calamity, make the country abundant and prosper in well-being, and increase the people and the host of gods.

source_sentence: 以是因緣，　　諸人王等，　　寧捨身命，　　不應為惡，　　不應捨離，　　正法珍寶。
translation: For this reason, human kings and others would rather give up their lives than do evil, and they mustn't part with the treasures of the right Dharma.

source_sentence: 由正法寶，　　世人受樂，　　常當親近，　　修正法者，　　聚集功德，　　莊嚴其身；　　於自眷屬，　　常知止足；　　當遠惡人，　　修治正法；　　安止眾生，　　於諸善法，　　教勅防護，　　令離不善。
translation: Because of the treasure of the right Dharma, people enjoy and always get close to those who cultivate the Dharma, gather merit, and adorn themselves; always know the contentment of their retinue; keep evil people far away, cultivate the right Dharma; calm sentient beings, teach and protect against good qualities, and cause them to part with unskillful things.

source_sentence: 是故國土，　　安隱豐樂，　　是王亦得，　　威德具足。
translation: As a result, his land is peaceful and abundant, and the king attains complete authority and virtue.

source_sentence: 隨諸人民，　　所行惡法，　　應當調伏，　　如法教詔，　　是王當得，　　好名善譽，　　善能攝護，　　安樂眾生。』」
translation: According to the people who practice bad qualities, they should be disciplined and instructed according to the teaching of the Dharma, and the king will attain a good reputation that's well known and well-regarded, and he'll be able to protect and bring comfort to sentient beings."

source_sentence: 金光明經善集品第十二
translation: Golden Light Sutra, Chapter XII of the Good Collection

source_sentence: 爾時如來復為地神，說往昔因緣，而作偈言：「我昔曾為，　　轉輪聖王，　　捨四大地，　及以大海；　　又於是時，　　以四天下，　滿中珍寶，　　奉上諸佛。
translation: The Tathāgata then again explained the causes and conditions of the past for the earth spirit and composed a verse, saying, "Once, for the turn-turning sage king, I abandoned the four great grounds and the ocean; at the time, I presented the four worlds, full of treasures, to the buddhas.

source_sentence: 凡所布施，　皆捨所重，　　不見可愛，　　而不捨者。
translation: Whatever gifts I gave, I always relinquished the valuables I had, and I didn't see anything desirable and didn't relinquish it.

source_sentence: 於過去世，　　無數劫中，　　求正法故，　常捨身命。
translation: In uncountable eons past, he always sacrificed his life in order to pursue the right teaching.

source_sentence: 又過去世，　　不可議劫，　有佛世尊，　　名曰寶勝。
translation: Also in a past time, an unfathomable eon, there was a Bhagavān called Prabhūtaratna.

source_sentence: 其佛世尊，　般涅槃後，　　時有聖王，　　名曰善集，　於四天下，　　而得自在，　　治正之勢，　盡大海際。
translation: After that Bhagavān passed into nirvāṇa, there was a noble king named Sunjip, who attained sovereignty under the four heavens and whose governing power was so great that it reached the limit of the ocean.

source_sentence: 其王有城，　　名水音尊，　於其城中，　　止住治化。
translation: That king had a city named Venerable Water Voice, and in that city he stayed there to govern and teach.

source_sentence: 夜睡夢中，　聞佛功德，　　及見比丘，　　名曰寶冥，　善能宣暢，　　如來正法，　　所謂金光，　微妙經典，　　明如日中，　　悉能遍照。
translation: In his nighttime sleep and dream, he hears of the Buddha's merits and sees a monk named Baomei, who well proclaims the Tathāgata's right teaching, which is called golden light and subtle sūtras that are as bright as the middle of the sun and completely illuminate them.

source_sentence: 是轉輪王，　　夢是事已，　　即尋覺寤，　心喜遍身，　　即出宮殿，　　至僧坊所，　供養恭敬，　　諸大聖眾，　　問諸大德：『是大眾中，　　頗有比丘，　　名曰寶冥，　成就一切，　　諸功德不？』
translation: After this dream, the wheel-turning king awoke from his senses, rejoiced, and went out of the palace, went to the monastery, made offerings, and paid respect to the great congregation of sages, asking the great virtues, 'Could it be that there's a monk named Prabhūtaratna among the great crowd who has accomplished all these virtues?'

source_sentence: 爾時寶冥，　在一窟中，　　安坐不動，　　思惟正念，　讀誦如是，　　金光明經。
translation: Jewel Meditation was sitting motionless in a cave, reflecting and correctly mindful, reciting this sutra of golden light.

source_sentence: 時有比丘，　即將是王，　　至其所止，　　到寶冥所。
translation: A monk then summoned the king to his stop and went to Baomedhara.

source_sentence: 時此寶冥，　　故在窟中，　　形貌殊特，　威德熾然。
translation: This Jewel Meditation was therefore in the cave, with a distinctive appearance and a blazing reputation.

source_sentence: 即示王言：　　『是窟中者，　即是所問，　　寶冥比丘。
translation: He then showed the king, 'That man in the cave is the monk who asked about Jewel Meditation.

source_sentence: 能持甚深，　諸佛所行，　　名金光明，　　諸經之王。』
translation: He's the one who can maintain the profundities practiced by the buddhas and is called 'Golden Light,' the king of sūtras.'

source_sentence: 時善集王，　　即尋禮敬，　　寶冥比丘，　作如是言：　　『面如滿月，　　威德熾然，　惟願為我，　　敷演宣說，　　是金光明，　諸經之王。』
translation: The well-appointed king then sought out and venerated the Bhagavān, saying, 'His face is like the full moon, his authority is blazing, and may he explain for me that this is Golden Light, the king of sūtras.'

source_sentence: 時寶冥尊，　　即受王請，　許為宣說，　　是金光明。
translation: The Venerable Prabhūtaratna then accepted the king's invitation and permitted him to expound this golden radiance.

source_sentence: 三千大千，　世界諸天，　　知當說法，　　悉生歡喜，　於淨微妙，　　鮮絜之處，　　種種珍寶，　廁填其地，　　上妙香水，　　持用灑之；　散諸好華，　　遍滿其處。
translation: Knowing that the teaching would be given, the gods of the 3,000 great one-thousand worlds rejoiced and filled the toilets with various treasures in a pure, subtle, and pure place, sprinkled them with the finest perfume, and scattered beautiful flowers all over the place.

source_sentence: 王於是時，　自敷法座，　　懸繒幡蓋，　　寶飾交絡，　種種微妙，　　殊特末香，　　悉以奉散，　大法高座。
translation: The king then spreads his own Dharma throne, drapes it with silken banners and flags, decorates it with jewels, and distributes it with various subtle and unusual fragrances, all on the high throne of the great Dharma.

source_sentence: 一切諸天、　　龍及鬼神、　摩睺羅伽、　　緊那羅等，　　即雨天上，　曼陀羅華，　　遍散法座，　　滿其處所；　不可思議，　　百千萬億，　　那由他等，　無量諸天，　　一時俱來，　　集說法所。
translation: All the gods, dragons, spirits, mahoragas, kiṃnaras, and so forth rained down mandaras from the heavens, scattering them all over the Dharma throne and filling its place with unfathomable, incalculable, one hundred thousand million, nayutas, and countless other gods who all came at once to gather at the place where the Dharma was taught.

source_sentence: 是時寶冥，　　尋從窟出，　　諸天即時，　以娑羅華，　　供養奉散，　　寶冥比丘。
translation: Jewel Maitreya then looked into the cave and emerged, and the gods then offered the Sala flowers to the Jewel Maitreya monks.

source_sentence: 是時寶冥，　　淨洗身體，　　著淨妙衣，　至法座所，　　合掌敬禮，　　是法高座；　一切天王，　　及諸天人，　　雨曼陀羅、　大曼陀羅、　　摩訶曼殊、　　眾妙寶華，　無量百千，　　種種妓樂，　　於虛空中，　不鼓自鳴。
translation: Jewel Meditation then cleansed himself, put on pure, fine clothing, went to the Dharma throne, put his palms together in respect, and venerated this high Dharma throne, where all the gods and goddesses rained down maṇḍalas, great maṇḍalas, mahāmañjū, and multitudes of marvelous jewels and flowers, numberless and hundreds of thousands, and various kinds of music, which roared in the sky without beating their own drums.

source_sentence: 寶冥比丘，　　能說法者，　尋上高座，　　結跏趺坐，　　即念十方，　不可思議，　　無量千億，　　諸佛世尊，　於諸眾生，　　興大悲心；　　及善集王，　所得王領，　　盡一日月，　　所照之處。
translation: The jeweled, mysterious monk who explains the teaching finds a high seat, sits cross-legged, and is mindful of the unfathomable, unfathomable, and unfathomable hundreds of millions of world-honored buddhas in the ten directions, the great compassionate mind they have for sentient beings, and the royal collar they've attained, the king of skillful gathering, and the place where the sun and moon shine.

source_sentence: 時說法者，　　即尋為王，　　敷揚宣說，　是妙經典。
translation: The Dharma preacher then sought to be the king, expounding and proclaiming this marvelous sūtra.

source_sentence: 是時大王，　　為聞法故，　於比丘前，　　合掌而立，　　聞於正法，　讚言善哉，　　其心悲悼，　　涕淚交流；　尋復踊悅，　　心意熙怡，　　為欲供養，　此經典故，　　爾時即提，　　如意珠王，　為諸眾生，　　發大誓願：　　『願於今日，　此閻浮提，　　悉雨無量，　　種種珍異，　瑰琦七寶，　　及妙瓔珞，　　以是因緣，　悉令無量，　　一切眾生，　　皆受快樂。』
translation: The great king then, because he had heard the teaching, stood before the monks with his palms together, praised the correct teaching, expressed his sorrow and heart, wept, and exchanged tears; then he became elated, his heart and mind were joyous, and he wished to make offerings to this sūtra, for the sake of its scriptures.

source_sentence: 即於爾時，　　尋雨七寶，　　及諸寶飾，　天冠耳璫、　　種種瓔珞、　　甘饌寶座，　悉皆充滿，　　遍四天下。
translation: At that point, he discovers that it's raining seven treasures and other jewelry, such as a crown of gods, earrings, various kinds of jewelry, and a jeweled seat of delicious food, and they all fill the four heavens.

source_sentence: 時王善集，　即持如是，　　滿四天下，　　無量七寶，　於寶勝佛，　　遺法之中，　　以用布施，　供養三寶。
translation: The king then, well-gathered, took this and filled the four heavens with measureless quantities of seven treasures, which he then used to make offerings to the Three Treasures amidst the legacy of the Jeweled One, the Buddha.

source_sentence: 爾時為王，　　說法比丘，　於今現在，　　阿閦佛是；　　時善集王，　聽受法者，　　今則我身，　　釋迦文是。
translation: The monk who taught the Dharma and was then king was Akṣobhya, and the one who listened to the Dharma and received the Dharma from the well-assembled king was Śākyamuni, who is now me.

source_sentence: 我於爾時，　　捨此大地，　　滿四天下，　珍寶布施，　　得聞如是，　　金光明經；　聞是經已，　　一稱善哉，　　以此善根，　業因緣故，　　身得金色，　　百福莊嚴，　常為無量，　　百千萬億，　　眾生等類，　之所樂見；　　既得見已，　　無有厭足。
translation: At the time, I gave up this great land, filled it with four worlds, and made offerings of treasures, and was able to hear this sutra of golden light; after hearing it, I said, "Good," and because of these good roots and the causes and conditions of my actions, my body became golden and adorned with a hundred merits, which are always pleasing to measureless and a hundred thousand million million sentient beings and other types of beings; once I had seen it, I didn't grow weary of it.

source_sentence: 過去九十，　　九億千劫，　　常得作於，　轉輪聖王；　　亦於無量，　　百千劫中，　常得王領，　　諸小國土；　　不可思議，　劫中常作，　　釋提桓因，　　及淨梵王；　復得值遇，　　十力世尊，　　其數無量，　不可稱計；　　所得功德，　　無量無邊，　皆由聞經，　　及稱善哉。
translation: In the past 90,000,000,000 eons, he's always been the wheel-turning sage king; in measureless, 100,000,000 eons, he's always been the king over small lands; unfathomably, throughout those eons, he's always been Śakra Devānām-Indra and the pure king of purity; and he's also had encounters with the world-honored one of the ten powers, whose number is incalculable and cannot be calculated; the merits he's attained are measureless and limitless, all because he's heard the sūtras and praised them as good.

source_sentence: 如我所願，　成就菩提，　　正法之身，　　我今已得。」
translation: As I had wished, I accomplished enlightenment, and now I've attained the body of the true Dharma."

source_sentence: 金光明經鬼神品第十三
translation: Sutra of Golden Light, Part XIII on Ghosts and Spirits

source_sentence: 佛告功德天：「若有善男子、善女人，欲以不可思議妙供養具供養過去未來現在諸佛世尊，及欲得知三世諸佛甚深行處，是人應當必定至心，隨有是經流布之處，若城邑村落舍宅空處，正念不亂，至心聽是微妙經典。」
translation: The Buddha addressed the Lakṣmī Heaven, "If there are good sons and good women who want to make unfathomably wonderful offerings to the world-honored buddhas of the past, future, and present, and who want to know the profound positions of the buddhas of the three times, they should surely and wholeheartedly follow the places where this sūtra is disseminated, such as cities, towns, villages, homes, and empty places, with correct mindfulness and not distracted, and wholeheartedly listen to this subtle sūtra."

source_sentence: 爾時世尊欲重宣此義，而說偈言：「若欲供養，　　一切諸佛，　　欲知三世，　諸佛行處，　　應當往彼，　　城邑聚落，　有是經處，　　至心聽受，　　是妙經典。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān wanted to reiterate this teaching and spoke the verse, "If you want to make offerings to all the buddhas and want to know about the three times and where they've traveled, you should go there, go to a town or village where this sūtra exists, and wholeheartedly listen to and accept this marvelous sūtra.

source_sentence: 不可思議，　　功德大海，　　無量無邊；　能令一切，　　眾生解脫，　　度無量苦，　諸有大海。
translation: Inconceivable, its ocean of merit is measureless and limitless, and it can cause all sentient beings to be liberated and liberate the ocean of measureless suffering and existence.

source_sentence: 是經甚深，　　初中後善，　不可得說，　　譬喻為比；　　假使恒沙、　大地微塵、　　大海諸水、　　一切諸山，　如是等物，　　不得為喻。
translation: This sūtra is so profound that it can't be explained in terms of its beginnings, middles, and endings, or compared to metaphors; even if it were the sands of the Ganges, the dust of the earth, the waters of the ocean, all the mountains, or such things, it couldn't be used as a metaphor.

source_sentence: 若入是經，　即入法性，　　如深法性，　　安住其中，　即於是典，　　金光明中，　　而得見我，　釋迦牟尼。
translation: If someone enters this sūtra, they'll enter the nature of dharmas like the profound nature of dharmas and abide in them, which is the scripture that reveals me, Śākyamuni, in golden light.

source_sentence: 不可思議，　　阿僧祇劫，　生天人中，　　常受快樂，　　以能信解，　聽是經故。
translation: Unfathomable, incalculable, and eons away, he'll be born among gods and humans and always experience happiness because he's able to believe and understand it and listen to this sūtra.

source_sentence: 如是無量，　　不可思議，　功德福聚，　　悉已得之。
translation: Such incalculable and unfathomable accumulations of merit and fortune have all been attained.

source_sentence: 隨所至處，　若百由旬，　　滿中盛火，　　應從中過；　若至聚落，　　阿蘭若處，　　到法會所，　至心聽受，　　聽是經故，　　惡夢蠱道、　五星諸宿、　　變異災禍，　　一切惡事，　消滅無餘。
translation: From wherever he goes, if he goes to a hundred leagues full of fire, he'll pass through it; if he goes to a village or forest or to a Dharma assembly, he'll listen wholeheartedly and accept the sūtras, so that bad dreams and rebirths, the five stars and constellations, conjuring up calamities, and all other bad things will cease without remainder.

source_sentence: 於說法處、　　蓮華座上，　說是經典，　　書寫讀誦，　　是說法者，　若下法座，　　爾時大眾，　　猶見坐處，　故有說者，　　或佛世尊，　　或見佛像、　菩薩色像、　　普賢菩薩、　　文殊師利、　彌勒大士，　　及諸形像；　　見如是等，　種種事已，　　尋復滅盡，　　如前無異。
translation: In the place where the teaching is given, on the lotus seat, these sūtras are taught, written, and recited, and if this speaker of the teaching descends from the Dharma seat, then the whole crowd still sees where they're sitting, so there are speakers, or they see images of the Buddha, the Bhagavān, images of bodhisattvas, the Bodhisattva Pratibhāna, Mañjuśrī, Maitreya Mahāsattva, and other forms; after seeing these kinds of things, they find that they again cease, just as before.

source_sentence: 成就如是，　　諸功德已，　　而為諸佛，　之所讚歎；　　威德相貌，　　無量無邊；　有大名稱，　　能却怨家；　　他方盜賊，　能令退散；　　勇捍多力，　　能破強敵；　惡夢惱心，　　無量惡業，　　如是惡事，　皆悉寂滅。
translation: After accomplishing such merits, they're praised by the buddhas as having measureless and limitless virtues and features, a great reputation that can vanquish enemies, thieves and robbers from other lands that can be scattered, courageous and powerful individuals who can defeat powerful enemies, hostile dreams that disturb the mind, measureless bad actions, and such bad deeds that are all completely extinguished.

source_sentence: 若入軍陣，　　常能勝他；　名聞流布，　　遍閻浮提；　　亦能摧伏，　一切怨敵；　　遠離諸惡，　　修習諸善；　入陣得勝，　　心常歡喜。
translation: If he enters an army battlefield, he's always able to outsmart others; his reputation spreads throughout Jambudvīpa; he's able to subdue all enemies; he parts with evil and cultivates goodness; he's always rejoicing when he enters battle and is victorious.

source_sentence: 大梵天王、　三十三天、　　護世四王、　　金剛密迹、　鬼神諸王、　　散脂大將、　　禪那英鬼，　及緊那羅、　　阿耨達龍、　　娑竭羅王、　阿脩羅王、　　迦樓羅王、　　大辯天神、　及功德天，　　如是上首，　　諸天神等，　常當供養，　　是聽法者，　　生不思議，　法塔之想；　　眾生見者，　　恭敬歡喜，　諸天王等，　　亦各思惟，　　而相謂言：『令是眾生，　　無量威德，　　皆悉成就。』
translation: The king of the Brahma gods, the Trāyastriṃśa gods, the four guardian kings, the vajra spirits, the demon spirit kings, the fat generals, the meditation ghosts, the kiṃnara, the anavatapta dragon, King Sāgara, King Ashura, King Garuḍa, the great eloquent gods, and the gods of merit are such heads that the gods and goddesses will always offer support, and those who hear the teaching will give rise to inconceivable notions of the Dharma tower; the sentient beings who see it will respect and rejoice, and the gods and goddesses will each reflect on it and say, 'Let these sentient beings attain measureless virtue.'

source_sentence: 若能來至，　　是法會所，　　如是之人，　成上善根；　　若有聽是，　　甚深經典，　故嚴出往，　　法會之處，　　心生不可，　思議正信，　　供養恭敬，　　無上法塔；　如是大悲，　　利益眾生，　　即是無量，　深法寶器，　　能入甚深，　　無上法性。
translation: If someone can come to this Dharma assembly, such a person will have accomplished excellent good roots; if they hear this profound sūtra, they'll emerge with dignity, go to the assembly, become uncertain in their minds, deliberate on correct faith, make offerings, and venerate the unsurpassed Dharma stūpa; thus, with great compassion, they'll benefit sentient beings, which are incalculable, profound Dharma treasure vessels that can enter the profound, unsurpassed nature of the Dharma.

source_sentence: 由以淨心，　　聽是經典，　　如是之人，　悉已供養，　　過去無量，　　百千諸佛；　以是善根，　　無量因緣，　　應當聽受，　是金光明。
translation: Because of this pure mind and listening to these sūtras, such a person has made offerings to measureless, one hundred thousand buddhas of the past; because of these good roots and measureless causes and conditions, they should hear and accept this golden radiance.

source_sentence: 如是眾生，　　常為無量，　諸天神王，　　之所愛護，　　大辯功德、　護世四王、　　無量鬼神，　　及諸力士，　晝夜精進，　　擁護四方，　　令無災禍，　永離諸苦。
translation: Such a sentient being is always loved by measureless gods and goddesses, great in eloquence, four guardian kings, measureless ghosts, and strong men who exert themselves day and night to guard the four directions, making them free of misfortune and permanently escaping suffering.

source_sentence: 釋提桓因，　　及日月天、　閻摩羅王、　　風水諸神、　　違馱天神，　及毘紐天、　　大辯天神，　　及自在天、　火神等神，　　大力勇猛，　　常護世間，　晝夜不離。
translation: Śakrodevānām, the sun and moon gods, King Yama, the gods of wind and water, the gods of the Vandha gods, the Viṣṇu gods, the Sarasvatī gods, and the fire gods and other gods are powerful and courageous, always protecting the world and not parting with it day and night.

source_sentence: 大力鬼王、　　那羅延等，　摩醯首羅、　　二十八部、　　諸鬼神等，　散脂為首，　　百千鬼神，　　神足大力，　擁護是等，　　令不怖畏。
translation: The king of powerful demons, Nārāyaṇa and others, Mahêśvara, the twenty-eight divisions, and other demon spirits, all led by a scattering of fatty ghosts, and a hundred thousand other demon spirits are powerful and capable, shielding them and making them not afraid.

source_sentence: 金剛密迹、　大鬼神王，　　及其眷屬，　　五百徒黨，　一切皆是，　　大菩薩等，　　亦悉擁護，　聽是經者。
translation: The Vajra Maitreya, the great demon king, and their retinues and five hundred disciples are all these, and the great bodhisattvas and others also support them and listen to this sūtra.

source_sentence: 摩尼跋陀、　　大鬼神王、　富那跋陀，　　及金毘羅、　　阿羅婆帝、　賓頭盧伽、　　黃頭大神，　　一一諸神，　各有五百，　　眷屬鬼神，　　亦常擁護，　聽是經者。
translation: Maṇibhadra, the great demon king, Pūrṇabhadra, Kimbila, Ārāvatī, Piṇḍoloka, and the great yellow-headed gods, each of whom has 500 members, and their retinues are always there to protect them and listen to this sūtra.

source_sentence: 質多斯那、　　阿脩羅王，　及乾闥婆、　　那羅羅闍、　　祁那娑婆、　摩尼乾陀，　　及尼揵陀、　　主雨大神、　大飲食神、　　摩訶伽吒、　　金色髮神、　半祁鬼神，　　及半攴羅、　　車鉢羅婆、　有大威德，　　婆那利神、　　曇摩跋羅、　摩竭婆羅、　　針髮鬼神、　　繡利蜜多、　勒那翅奢、　　摩訶婆那，　　及軍陀遮、　劍摩舍帝，　　復有大神，　　奢羅蜜帝、　醯摩跋陀、　　薩多琦梨、　　多醯波醯、　阿伽跋羅、　　支羅摩伽、　　央掘摩羅，　如是等神，　　皆有無量，　　神足大力，　常勤擁護，　　聽受如是，　　微妙經者。
translation: Cydosna, King Asura, Gandharva, Nārāja, Kisnaśva, Manikandha, Nirgrantha, the great rain-giving god, the great food-giving god, Mahāgaṭṭa, the golden-haired god, the demon god Panchi, Half Tapra, Cheboloupo, the god of great authority, the god Banali, Dharmapala, Maghapala, the needle-haired demon god, Sūryamitra, Ranaketu, Mahābana, Juntacar, and Karmasheti, and the great gods Śrāmitra, Hemabhadra, Sātaqiri, Mahêśvara, Aggabhara, Cīrāmagha, and Aṅgulimāla are all numberless, powerful, and always diligently guarded by those who listen to and accept such subtle sūtras.

source_sentence: 阿耨達龍、　　娑伽羅王、　　目真隣王、　伊羅鉢王、　　難陀龍王、　　跋難陀王、　有如是等，　　百千龍王，　　以大神力，　常來擁護，　　聽是經者，　　晝夜不離。
translation: Anavatapta-nāga-rāja, Sāgara-rāja, Mucilinda-rāja, Airāva-nāga-rāja, Nandana-nāga-rāja, and Vānanda-nāga-rāja, there are a hundred thousand dragon kings like these who always come to be guarded by their great spiritual powers and listen to these sūtras day and night without leaving.

source_sentence: 波利羅睺、　　阿脩羅王、　　毘摩質多，　及以茂脂、　　睒摩利子、　　波訶梨子、　佉羅騫陀，　　及以揵陀，　　是等皆是，　阿脩羅王，　　有大神力，　　常來擁護，　聽是經者，　　晝夜不離。
translation: Parīrāhu, King Ashura, Vimalacitra, Maudgalyāyana, Śāmālīputra, Pāṭaliputra, Kharakaṇṭha, and Gandha, these are all kings of Ashura with great spiritual powers who always come to guard and listen to these sūtras, and they don't part from them day and night.

source_sentence: 訶利帝南、　鬼子母等、　　及五百神，　　常來擁護，　聽是經者，　　若睡若寤。
translation: Hāritīnā, Mṛgāra, Māra, and the other five hundred spirits always come to guard them, and they listen to these sūtras whether they're asleep or awake.

source_sentence: 旃陀旃陀、　利大鬼神、　　女等鳩羅、　　鳩羅檀提，　噉人精氣，　　如是等神，　　皆有大力，　常勤擁護，　　十方世界，　　受持經者。
translation: Candra-candra, the great sharp demons, Kukkuṭapāda, and Kukkuṭānta eat human energy, and such spirits are powerful and always diligently support those who accept the sūtras in the ten directions of the world.

source_sentence: 大辯天等，　　無量天女，　　功德天等，　各與眷屬，　　地神堅牢，　　種植園林，　果實大神，　　如是諸神，　　心生歡喜，　悉來擁護，　　愛樂親近，　　是經典者。
translation: The great eloquent gods and so forth, the numberless goddesses and gods of merit, each with their retinues, the earth deities who are firm and resolute, the gods who plant groves and great deities of fruit, and such deities are delighted at heart, all come to embrace, love, and are close to this scripture.

source_sentence: 於諸眾生，　　增命色力，　　功德威貌，　莊嚴倍常；　　五星諸宿、　　變異災怪，　皆悉能滅，　　無有遺餘；　　夜臥惡夢，　寤則憂悴，　　如是惡事，　　皆悉滅盡。
translation: They are able to extinguish the five stars, constellations, and strange and disastrous things without remainder, and they all cease such bad deeds as lying in a bad dream at night and waking up distressed.

source_sentence: 地神大力，　　勢分甚深，　　是經力故，　能變其味；　　如是大地，　　至金剛際，　厚十六萬，　　八千由旬，　　其中氣味，　無不遍有，　　悉令涌出，　　潤益眾生。
translation: The earth spirit's great strength and power are so profound that it's possible to change its flavor because of the power of this sūtra; thus, the earth reaches the limit of the vajra, is 160,000 or 8,000 leagues thick, and there's no smell or odor that doesn't pervade it, which causes it to spring forth and enrich sentient beings.

source_sentence: 是經力故，　　能令地味，　　悉出地上，　厚百由旬，　　亦令諸天，　　大得精氣，　充益身力，　　歡喜快樂。
translation: Because of the power of this sūtra, it causes the flavors of the earth to spring forth from the earth, which is 100 leagues thick, and it causes the gods to greatly attain energy, which fills their bodies with strength and makes them rejoice and be happy.

source_sentence: 閻浮提內，　所有諸神，　　心生歡喜，　　受樂無量；　是經力故，　　諸天歡喜，　　百穀果實，　皆悉滋茂，　　園苑叢林，　　其華開敷，　香氣馝馚，　　充溢彌滿；　　百草樹木，　生長端直，　　其體柔軟，　　無有斜戾。
translation: Within Jambudvīpa, all the spirits rejoice and experience immeasurable happiness, and the gods rejoice because of the power of this sūtra, which nourishes the fruits of all grains, blooms the flowers of garden groves, perfumes and fills them with fragrance, and produces long, straight grasses and trees with supple bodies that aren't crooked.

source_sentence: 閻浮提內，　　所有龍女，　　其數無量，　不可思議，　　心生歡喜，　　踊躍無量，　在在處處，　　莊嚴華池，　　於其池中，　生種種華：　　優鉢羅華、　　波頭摩華、　拘物頭華、　　分陀利華；　　於自宮殿，　除諸雲霧，　　令虛空中，　　無有塵翳，　諸方清徹，　　淨潔明了；　　日王赫焰，　放千光明，　　歡喜踊躍，　　照諸闇蔽。
translation: Within Jambudvīpa, there are dragons and nymphs whose number is unfathomable, whose hearts rejoice and leap, and who adorn the flower ponds everywhere, producing in them various kinds of flowers: the utpala flower, the padma flower, the kovidāra flower, and the puṇḍarī flower. In their own palaces, they remove clouds and mists, leaving the sky without dust or obscuration and all directions clear and crisp, with purity and clarity; the sun king's blazing light radiates a thousand rays of light, and they rejoice and leap, illuminating darkness.

source_sentence: 閻浮檀金，　　以為宮殿，　　止住其中，　威德無量。
translation: That gold of jambu becomes a palace, and it stands within it, its power is immeasurable.

source_sentence: 日之天子，　　及以月天，　聞是經故，　　精氣充實。
translation: The sun gods and moon gods hear this sūtra, and their energy is recharged.

source_sentence: 是日天子，　出閻浮提，　　心生歡喜，　　放於無量，　光明明網，　　遍照諸方；　　即於出時，　放大光網，　　開敷種種，　　諸池蓮華。
translation: When that sun-being emerged from Jambudvīpa, his heart became joyous, and he released a limitless net of bright light that shone everywhere; when he emerged, he magnified that net of light and spread out various lotus flowers in pools.

source_sentence: 閻浮提內，　　無量果實，　　隨時成熟，　飽諸眾生。
translation: Within Jambudvīpa, measureless fruits ripen at the appropriate time to feed sentient beings.

source_sentence: 是時日月，　　所照殊勝；　星宿正行，　　不失度數；　　風雨隨時，　豐實熾盛；　　多饒財寶，　　無所乏少。
translation: The sun and moon then shine brilliantly, the stars travel correctly, they don't lose their measure, the wind and rain come at appropriate times, they're abundant and flourishing, and there's no lack of abundant treasure.

source_sentence: 是金光明，　　微妙經典，　　隨所流布，　讀誦之處，　　其國土境，　　即得增益，　如上所說，　　無量功德。」
translation: This golden light, a marvelous scripture, is disseminated as it is, and where it's recited, the lands and realms of those lands are immediately enriched with measureless merit as explained above."

source_sentence: 金光明經授記品第十四
translation: The 14th Chapter of the Sutra of Golden Light's Empowering Notes

source_sentence: 爾時如來，將欲為是信相菩薩及其二子銀相、銀光，授阿耨多羅三藐三菩提記。
translation: It was then that the Tathāgata wanted to confer the mark of unsurpassed, correct enlightenment on this Shinshō Bodhisattva and his two sons, Jinsang and Jinguang.

source_sentence: 是時即有十千天子，威德熾王而為上首，俱從忉利來至佛所，頂禮佛足却坐一面。
translation: At that point, ten thousand celestials, headed by Bhadrapāla, came from the Thirty-three and bowed their heads at the Buddha's feet and withdrew to sit at one side.

source_sentence: 爾時佛告信相菩薩：「汝於來世，過無量無邊百千萬億不可稱計那由他劫，金照世界，當成阿耨多羅三藐三菩提，號金寶蓋山王如來、應供、正遍知、明行足、善逝、世間解、無上士、調御丈夫、天人師、佛、世尊。
translation: It was then that the Buddha addressed the Bodhisattva Shinshō, "In a future life, after measureless and limitless hundreds of thousands of trillions of incalculable nayutas, you will shine forth in gold in the world and become an unsurpassed, correct, and complete bodhisattva called the Tathāgata, the King of Golden Treasures, the Worthy Offerer, the Perfectly Omniscient, the Perfection of Clear Conduct, the Well Gone, the Understander of the World, the Unsurpassed One, the Trainer, the Teacher of Gods and People, the Buddha, and the World Honored One.

source_sentence: 乃至是佛般涅槃後，正法像法皆滅盡已，長子銀相，當於是界次補佛處，世界爾時轉名淨幢，佛名閻浮檀金幢光照明如來、應供、正遍知、明行足、善逝、世間解、無上士、調御丈夫、天人師、佛、世尊。
translation: Even after the Buddha's parinirvāṇa and the cessation of all true dharmas and semblances, when the eldest son, Jāṅgulī, takes up residence in this place next to the Buddha, the world is then renamed Jambudvīpa, and the Buddha is called Jambudvīpa-gold-banner-illuminating Tathāgata, Worthy of Offerings, Perfectly Omniscient, Perfect in Knowledge and Conduct, Well Gone, Understander of the World, Unsurpassed, Trainer of Men, Teacher of Gods, Buddha, and Bhagavān.

source_sentence: 乃至是佛般涅槃後，正法像法悉滅盡已，次子銀光，復於是後次補佛處，世界名字如本不異，佛號曰金光照如來、應供、正遍知、明行足、善逝、世間解、無上士、調御丈夫、天人師、佛、世尊。」
translation: Even after the Buddha's parinirvāṇa and the cessation of all correct dharmas and semblances, the next child, Jñāniputra, will again fill in the place of the Buddha after that, and the world's name will be Golden Banner Illuminating Tathāgata, Worthy of Offerings, Perfectly Omniscient, Perfect in Knowledge and Conduct, Well Gone, Soldier of the World, Unsurpassed Person, Trainer of Husbands, Teacher of Gods and Humans, Buddha, and Bhagavān."

source_sentence: 是十千天子，聞三大士得受記莂，復聞如是金光明經，聞已歡喜生殷重心，心無垢累如淨琉璃，清淨無礙猶如虛空。
translation: Those 10,000 celestials who heard that the three bodhisattvas had received assurance of future enlightenment and also heard this golden-radiance sūtra rejoiced and ardently focused their hearts, their minds were unsullied like pure emerald, and they were pure and unobstructed like space.

source_sentence: 爾時如來，知是十千天子善根成熟，即便與授菩提道記：「汝等天子！
translation: Knowing that these 10,000 sons of gods had matured their good roots, the Tathāgata then even granted them assurance of the path to enlightenment, "You sons of gods!

source_sentence: 於當來世，過阿僧祇百千萬億那由他劫，於是世界，當成阿耨多羅三藐三菩提，同共一家一姓一名，號曰青目優鉢羅華香山如來、應供、正遍知、明行足、善逝、世間解、無上士、調御丈夫、天人師、佛、世尊，如是次第出現於世，凡一萬佛。」
translation: In a future age, after incalculably long hundreds of thousands of trillion nayutas, in this world there will be accomplished the unsurpassed, correct, and complete enlightenment of three buddhas, all of whom will be of one family and one name, called the blue-eyed Upalakṣa Tathāgata, Worthy of Offerings, Perfectly Omniscient, Perfectly Virtuous, Well Gone, Understander of the World, Unsurpassed Person, Trainer of Men, Teacher of Gods, Buddha, and World Honored, and will appear in the world in this order, numbering 10,000 buddhas."

source_sentence: 爾時道場菩提樹神，名等增益，白佛言：「世尊！
translation: It was then that the bodhi tree spirit of the enlightenment site, who was called Equipoise, said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 是十千天子，於忉利宮為聽法故故來集此，云何如來便與授記？
translation: These 10,000 sons of gods gathered here at the palace of the Thirty-three because they wanted to hear the teaching, so why did the Tathāgata then give them a prediction?

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我未曾聞是諸天子修行具足六波羅蜜，亦未曾聞捨於手足頭目髓腦、所愛妻子財寶穀帛、金銀琉璃硨磲碼碯、真珠珊瑚珂貝璧玉、甘饌飲食衣服臥具、病瘦醫藥象馬車乘、殿堂屋宅園林泉池奴婢僕使，如餘無量百千菩薩，以種種資生供養之具，恭敬供養過去無量百千萬億那由他等諸佛世尊。
translation: I've never heard of gods cultivating the perfection of the six perfections, nor have I ever heard of gods abandoning their hands and feet, heads, eyes, marrow, brains, favorite wives, treasures, grain, and silk, gold and silver, lapis lazuli, coral, coral, coral, precious stones, sweet food and drink, clothing and bedding, medicines for illness and decay, elephants, horses, carriages, temples, mansions, gardens, forests, springs, pools, servants, and messengers, just like the other incalculable hundreds of thousands of bodhisattvas who made various provisions to support the lives of measureless hundreds of thousands of myriad nayutas and other world-honored buddhas in the past.

source_sentence: 如是菩薩於未來世，亦捨無量所重之物，頭目髓腦所愛妻子財寶穀帛乃至僕使，次第修行，成就具足六波羅蜜，成就是已備修苦行，動經無量無邊劫數，然後方得受菩提記。
translation: In the future, such bodhisattvas will also abandon countless valued possessions, the wives they love with their heads, eyes, marrow, brains, treasure, grain, and silk, and even their servants, cultivate their practices in order, achieve the full set of the six perfections, and prepare for ascetic practices that will move them through measureless and limitless eons before they'll be able to receive the assurance of enlightenment.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 是天子等何因何緣，修行何等勝妙善根，從彼天來暫得聞法便得受記？
translation: What causes and conditions did these sons of gods cultivate such excellent and wonderful good roots that they were able to hear the Dharma for a moment and then receive assurance from that heavenly being?

source_sentence: 惟願世尊，為我解說斷我疑網。」
translation: May the Bhagavān explain this for me and cut off my web of doubt."

source_sentence: 爾時佛告樹神：「善女天！
translation: It was then that the Buddha addressed the tree goddess, "Good girl gods!

source_sentence: 皆有因緣，有妙善根，以隨相修。
translation: "All have causes and conditions, and there are wonderful good roots that are cultivated by following characteristics.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 以是天子於所住處捨五欲樂，故來聽是《金光明經》，既聞法已，於是經中淨心殷重如說修行，復得聞此三大菩薩受於記莂，亦以過去本昔發心誓願因緣，是故我今皆與受記，於未來世，當成阿耨多羅三藐三菩提。」
translation: Because this celestial renounced the five desires and pleasures where he lived, he came to listen to this Sutra of Golden Light. Having heard the teaching, he purified his mind and diligently cultivated it as it was taught, and then he was able to hear that these three great bodhisattvas had received assurance of future enlightenment, and because of the causes and conditions of their past vows, I will now accept assurance of future attainment of unsurpassed, correct enlightenment."

source_sentence: 金光明經除病品第十五
translation: Sutra of Golden Light, Chapter 15 on Eliminating Disease

source_sentence: 佛告道場菩提樹神：「善女天！
translation: The Buddha addressed the Bodhi Tree spirit of the site of enlightenment, "Good girl gods!

source_sentence: 諦聽，諦聽！
translation: Listen closely, listen closely!

source_sentence: 善持憶念，我當為汝演說往昔誓願因緣。
translation: "Keep well in mind, and I will explain for you the causes and conditions of past vows.

source_sentence: 過去無量不可思議阿僧祇劫，爾時有佛出現於世，名曰寶勝如來、應供、正遍知、明行足、善逝、世間解、無上士、調御丈夫、天人師、佛、世尊。
translation: In the unfathomable incalculable eons of the past, there was a Buddha who appeared in the world and was called the Jeweled Tathāgata, Worthy of Offerings, Perfectly Omniscient, Perfect in Knowledge and Conduct, Well Gone, Understander of the World, Unsurpassed Person, Trainer, Teacher of Gods and People, Buddha, and World Honored One.

source_sentence: 善女天！
translation: Good girl gods!

source_sentence: 爾時是佛般涅槃後，正法滅已，於像法中，有王名曰天自在光王，修行正法如法治世，人民和順孝養父母。
translation: It was then that, after the Buddha's parinirvāṇa and the cessation of the right Dharma, there was a king named Deva Sovereign Light King who cultivated the right Dharma and ruled the world while his people were harmonious and dutiful to their parents.

source_sentence: 是王國中有一長者名曰持水，善知醫方救諸病苦，方便巧知四大增損。
translation: In that kingdom, there was an elder named Carrying Water who well knew the remedies to save people from illness and pain and the skillful means to know the increase and decrease of the four elements.

source_sentence: 善女天！
translation: Good girl gods!

source_sentence: 爾時持水長者家中，後生一子名曰流水，體貌殊勝端正第一，形色微妙威德具足，受性聰敏善解諸論，種種技藝書疏算計無不通達。
translation: It was then that a man who held water in his household gave birth to a son named Liujiang, who was distinguished and correct in appearance, had subtle features and an abundance of authority, was intelligent and well-versed in the understanding of treatises, and had no lack of proficiency in various arts and crafts, reading and writing, and arithmetic.

source_sentence: 是時國內天降疫病，有無量百千諸眾生等，皆無免者，為諸苦惱之所逼切。
translation: An epidemic then rained down from the heavens in their country, and measureless hundreds of thousands of sentient beings were spared, overcome by suffering and distress.

source_sentence: 「善女天！
translation: "Good women, gods!

source_sentence: 爾時流水長者子，見是無量百千眾生受諸苦惱故，為是眾生生大悲心，作是思惟：『如是無量百千眾生受諸苦惱。
translation: It was then that the elder son of Running Water, seeing the measureless hundreds of thousands of sentient beings suffering and distressing, gave rise to a great compassionate attitude for those sentient beings and thought, 'So it is that measureless hundreds of thousands of sentient beings are suffering and distressing.

source_sentence: 我父長者，雖善醫方能救諸苦，方便巧知四太增損，年已衰邁老耄枯悴，皮緩面皺羸瘦顫掉，行來往反要因几杖，困頓疲乏不能至彼城邑聚落；而是無量百千眾生，復遇重病無能救者，我今當至大醫父所諮問治病醫方祕法，諮稟知已，當至城邑聚落村舍治諸眾生種種重病，悉令得脫無量諸苦。』
translation: Although my father, the elder, is a good doctor who can save sentient beings from suffering, he skillfully knows that the four great doctors are increasing and decreasing, that he's aged and old and withered, that his skin is loose and wrinkled, that he's thin and shaky, that he has to walk back and forth because of a few sticks, and that he's too fatigued and exhausted to go to that town or village, and that there are measureless hundreds of thousands of sentient beings who are suffering from serious illnesses that no one can save, so now I will go to the father of the great doctors and ask him about the prescriptions and secrets for curing illnesses, and after I've consulted him and learned them, I will go to the town or village and treat the various serious illnesses of sentient beings, so that they will all be freed from measureless suffering.'

source_sentence: 「時長者子思惟是已，即至父所頭面著地，為父作禮叉手却住，以四大增損而問於父，即說偈言：「『云何當知，　　四大諸根，　　衰損代謝，　　而得諸病？
translation: "After he had thought about this, the elder son went to his father, put his head on the ground, saluted him, saluted him with his palms together, and asked him about the four major increases and decreases, saying, "How do you know that the four major organs decay and deteriorate and metabolize, and that they cause illnesses?

source_sentence: 云何當知，　　飲食時節，　　若食食已，　　身火不滅？
translation: How do you know that when you eat and drink, if you eat and eat, the fire in your body doesn't go out?

source_sentence: 云何當知，　　治風及熱，　　水過胏病　　及以等分？
translation: "How should you know how to treat wind and fever, the disease of excess water, and so forth?

source_sentence: 何時動風、　　何時動熱、　　何時動水，　　以害眾生？』
translation: When do you move wind, heat, or water to harm sentient beings?'

source_sentence: 時父長者，　　即以偈頌，　　解說醫方，　　而答其子：　　『三月是夏，　　三月是秋，　　三月是冬，　　三月是春，　　是十二月，　　三三而說。
translation: The father then explained the prescription in verse and answered his son, 'Three months are summer, three months are autumn, three months are winter, three months are spring, and it's December, and it's said three times out of three.

source_sentence: 從如是數，　　一歲四時；　　若二二說，　　足滿六時；　　三三本攝，　　二二現時，　　隨是時節，　　消息飲食，　　是能益身。
translation: From this number, a year has four seasons; if two or two are explained, it's enough for six seasons; three or three are originally included, two or two are present, and according to these times and seasons, food and drink are taught, which can benefit the body.

source_sentence: 醫方所說，　　隨時歲中，　　諸根四大，　　代謝增損，　　令身得病。
translation: According to medical prescriptions, during each of these seasons, the four major organs of the faculties metabolize and increase and decrease, causing the body to become ill.

source_sentence: 有善醫師，　　隨順四時，　　三月將養，　　調和六大，　　隨病飲食，　　及以湯藥。
translation: There are good doctors who follow the four seasons, maintain the three months, harmonize the six elements, eat and drink according to illness, and administer medicines.

source_sentence: 多風病者，　　夏則發動；　　其熱病者，　　秋則發動；　　等分病者，　　冬則發動；　　其肺病者，　　春則增劇。
translation: When there's a lot of wind trouble, it starts in summer; when there's fever trouble, it starts in autumn; when there's equal parts trouble, it starts in winter; and when there's lung trouble, it intensifies in spring.

source_sentence: 有風病者，　　夏則應服，　　肥膩醎酢，　　及以熱食；　　有熱病者，　　秋服冷甜，　　等分冬服，　　甜酢肥膩；　　肺病春服，　　肥膩辛熱。
translation: Those with windy conditions take something fat, greasy, salty, and hot in the summer; those with feverish conditions take something cold and sweet in the fall; those with similar conditions take something sweet and vinegary in the winter; and those with lung conditions take something fat, greasy, pungent, and hot in the spring.

source_sentence: 飽食然後，　　則發肺病；　　於食消時，　　則發熱病；　　食消已後，　　則發風病。
translation: After they've eaten, lung disease occurs; when they've finished eating, feverish disease occurs; and after they've finished eating, wind disease occurs.

source_sentence: 如是四大，　　隨三時發，　　風病羸損，　　補以酥膩；　　熱病下藥，　　服訶梨勒；　　等病應服，　　三種妙藥，　　所謂甜辛，　　及以酥膩；　　肺病應服，　　隨能吐藥。
translation: These four major types of medicine are given at three different times: those for wind trouble that's debilitating, which is made with butter and grease; those for fever trouble that's given as a downer, which is given as a heliotrope; those for similar trouble that's given as three wonderful medicines that are sweet, pungent, and greasy; and those for lung trouble that's given as a spiteful medicine.

source_sentence: 若風熱病，　　肺病等分，　　違時而發，　　應當任師，　　籌量隨病，　　飲食湯藥。』
translation: If a feverish illness or a lung condition that occurs at an inappropriate time, you should appoint a teacher to prepare a meal and medicine according to your illness.'

source_sentence: 「善女天！
translation: "Good women, gods!

source_sentence: 爾時流水長者子，問其父醫四大增損，因是得了一切醫方。
translation: It was then that the son of a flowing river elder asked his father about the four major additions and subtractions to medicine, and as a result, he was able to obtain all the prescriptions for medicine.

source_sentence: 時長者子知醫方已，遍至國內城邑聚落，在在處處隨有眾生病苦者所，軟言慰喻作如是言：『我是醫師，我是醫師，善知方藥，今當為汝療治救濟悉令除愈。』
translation: After he knew the remedies, the elder son went to every town and village in his country, and wherever there were people who were sick and suffering, he spoke softly and reassured them, saying, 'I am a physician, I am a physician who well knows the remedies, and I will treat and rescue you now so that you'll be healed.'

source_sentence: 「善女天！
translation: "Good women, gods!

source_sentence: 爾時眾生聞長者子軟言慰喻許為治病，心生歡喜踊躍無量。
translation: When sentient beings hear the eldest son's gentle words and reassurances that he'll treat their illnesses, their hearts rejoice and they jump for joy.

source_sentence: 時有百千無量眾生，遇極重病，直聞是言，心歡喜故，種種所患即得除差，平復如本氣力充實。
translation: When hundreds of thousands of measureless sentient beings who are experiencing an extremely serious illness hear those words directly, their hearts rejoice, and they are relieved of their various afflictions and return to their original level with renewed vitality.

source_sentence: 「善女天！
translation: "Good women, gods!

source_sentence: 復有無量百千眾生，病苦深重難除差者，即共來至長者子所，時長者子，即以妙藥授之令服，服已除差亦得平復。
translation: Measureless hundreds of thousands of other sentient beings who are suffering from a condition that's too severe to be remedied then come together to the eldest son, who then gives them a wonderful medicine to take, and after taking it, they're freed from the condition and are calmed.

source_sentence: 「善女天！
translation: "Good women, gods!

source_sentence: 是長者子，於其國內治諸眾生所有病苦悉得除差。」
translation: This is the son of an elder who treats all the illnesses and sufferings of sentient beings in his country and is able to remove them all."
